author: Special Correspondent
text:
The first level inspection of the Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) to be used in the forthcoming Assembly elections commenced in the city on Saturday.

The District Collector V. Sampath inaugurated the testing process in the presence of R. Sukumar, District Revenue Officer and the representatives of recognised political parties.

The district has already received 2,772 control units and 2,762 ballot units from Pune, 1,000 control units and 3,768 ballot units from Bihar in the last few days. The district already accounted for 930 control units and 1,343 ballot units. Senior engineers from Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) have come down to conduct the first level test of the EVMs and the process will be continued for 12 days.

Two officials in the rank of Deputy Collectors will monitor the inspection work.

Tight security

The officials will remove the records of any previous elections and also papers. Later they will feed fresh names, which too will be removed.

The scrutiny of the EVMs is being done under tight security arrangements, an official press release issued here said.

The district has already received 2,772 control units and 2,762 ballot units from Pune
title: Collector inaugurates testing process of EVMs
